Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk oprofile
exit 0

if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: oprofile bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: OProfile is a system-wide profiler for Linux systems. The profiling runs transparently in the background and profile data can be collected at any time. OProfile uses the hardware performance counters provided on many processors and can use the Real Time Clock (RTC) for profiling on processors without counters. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, on some IBM POWER8 systems, the oprofile utility did not properly identify the processor type. As a consequence, the "operf" and "ocount" commands failed to collect performance data and printed the following error message instead: Unable to open cpu_type file for reading Make sure you have done opcontrol --init Unable to find default event With this update, oprofile has been fixed to correctly identify the missing variants of IBM POWER8 processors, and the described problem no longer occurs. (BZ#1148525) On IBM POWER systems, the operf utility did not handle invalid or empty arguments for the "-e, --event" option properly. Consequently, operf terminated unexpectedly with a segmentation fault. The operf utility has been fixed to print an informative error message, and it no longer crashes in this scenario. (BZ#1073031) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: This update adds support for the 64-bit ARM architecture processor implementations to OProfile, namely Applied Micro X-Gene and ARM Cortex A57 processors. (BZ#963447) Support for the 5th Generation Intel® Core™ Processors has been added to OProfile. (BZ#1086836) This version of OProfile introduces support for IBM POWER8 systems. (BZ#1088558) Support for Intel® Atom™ processors has been added to OProfile. (BZ#1129875) Users of oprofile are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
